conclusion: Analyzing forces on metal rod MN and determining circuit conditions for stationary rod.
Metal rod MN placed on parallel rails separated by 0.15 m, inclined at 30° to horizontal.
Rod mass is 0.017 kg, resistance R₁ is 4 Ω, rheostat R₂ in series.
Magnetic field B is 0.6 T vertically upward, power source E is 10 V with internal resistance r is 1 Ω.
Rod remains stationary on smooth rails, g is 10 m/s².
Forces on stationary rod: gravitational force component mg·sin(30°) and Ampere force F_A = BIL balance.
Calculate gravitational force component: F_g_parallel = 0.017 kg × 10 m/s² × 0.5 = 0.085 N.
Set up equation for Ampere force: F_A = BIL = 0.085 N, L = 0.15 m, B = 0.6 T.
Calculate current I: I = 0.085 N / (0.6 T × 0.15 m) = 0.944... A ≈ 0.9 A.
Determine circuit parameters using Ohm's law: E = I(R₁ + R₂ + r), 10 V = I(5 Ω + R₂).
Substitute I = 0.944... A to find R₂: R₂ = (10 V / 0.944... A) - 5 Ω = 5.59... Ω ≈ 6 Ω.
Calculate Ampere force magnitude: F_A = 0.6 T × 0.944... A × 0.15 m = 0.085 N.
Final Ampere force with one significant figure: F_A = 0.09 N.
Final answer: Ampere force magnitude is 0.09 N, resistance value of R₂ is 6 Ω.
